channel.title: CVE Feed for WordPress.org -- WordPress
channel.description: The latest CVEs for WordPress.org -- WordPress

item.title: CVE-2022-43497|2024-08-03T13:32:59.252Z -- wordpress.org -- wordpress
item.description: Cross-site scripting vulnerability in WordPress versions prior to 6.0.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to inject an arbitrary script. The developer also provides new patched releases for all versions since 3.7.

item.title: CVE-2022-43500|2024-08-03T13:32:59.666Z -- wordpress.org -- wordpress
item.description: Cross-site scripting vulnerability in WordPress versions prior to 6.0.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to inject an arbitrary script. The developer also provides new patched releases for all versions since 3.7.

item.title: CVE-2022-43504|2024-08-03T13:32:59.652Z -- wordpress.org -- wordpress
item.description: Improper authentication vulnerability in WordPress versions prior to 6.0.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to obtain the email address of the user who posted a blog using the WordPress Post by Email Feature. The developer also provides new patched releases for all versions since 3.7.
